metadata.title: CVE-2019-14378 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
ip_reass in ip_input.c in libslirp 4.0.0 has a heap-based buffer overflowvia a large packet because it mishandles a case involving the firstfragment.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14378` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: android: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
basilisk2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
bochs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
fs-uae: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47').
slirp package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
vde2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xen: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
